intro: Dalechampia linearis var. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dalechampia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, with a unique structure typical of the spurge family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
